content.description: Both nonzero functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are invertible. The input values of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are times, in hours, and the output values of <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> are rates, in miles per hour. The input values of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are rates, in miles per hour, and the output values of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are costs, in dollars.
content.question: For which of the following are the input values costs, in dollars, and the output values times, in hours?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses g open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="y equals g inverse open parentheses f inverse open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="y equals f inverse open parentheses g inverse open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="y equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals f inverse open parentheses g inverse open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
